title: System Design Category Quiz
description: Core system design terms and interview flow.

questions.question: Scalability is mostly about:
options: Handling growth in traffic and users
questions.explanation: Scalability addresses sustained performance as demand grows.

questions.question: Availability means:
options: The system stays usable despite failures
The system has zero bugs forever
The system uses one server only
questions.explanation: Availability is about uptime and service accessibility.

questions.question: A typical architecture building block is:
questions.explanation: Workers process async tasks outside request-response paths.

questions.question: A good system design interview starts with:
questions.explanation: Requirements drive all architecture and tradeoff decisions.

questions.question: Load balancers are used to:
questions.explanation: They spread incoming requests for better capacity and resilience.
